content.body: how come `class Foo extends "bar" {}` is valid syntax given that even with return override it can't ever work?
content.formatted_body: how come class Foo extends "bar" {} is valid syntax given that even with return override it can't ever work?

content.body: How come (3)() is valid syntax even though it can't ever work?

> <@bakkot:matrix.org> I still do not understand why anyone wants this

content.body: we just don't make all the runtime errors into syntax errors, in general. Tools have been doing a good job of filling the gap.
